description_txt: stated on April 22, 2016 in an attack ad:
quote_txt: Says Donald Trump thinks "a grown man pretending to be a woman (should) be allowed to use the women's restroom."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2016 in remarks in Borden, Ind.:
quote_txt: "I earned more votes in the state of Wisconsin than Donald Trump did in New York."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2016 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Over the past two years, Florida has cut more than $1 billion in taxes."

description_txt: stated on April 22, 2016 in In a statement to Philadelphia magazine:
quote_txt: "A tax on soda and juice drinks would disproportionately increase taxes on low-income families in Philadelphia."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2016 in an article posted on Medium:
quote_txt: "In Africa, a child dies every minute because of (malaria)."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2016 in a debate:
quote_txt: "As a former federal prosecutor, I prosecuted over 4,000 cases."

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2016 in a website post.:
quote_txt: "Before taking executive action on immigration, President Obama stated 22 times that he does not have the authority to change immigration laws on his own."

description_txt: stated on April 24, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "We know that Saudi Arabia started al-Qaida."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 24, 2016

description_txt: stated on April 24, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: In the 2014 election, "80 percent of poor people did not vote."

description_txt: stated on April 16, 2016 in a radio ad in spanish:
quote_txt: "She is the only candidate who has stood by our community and immigration reform from the beginning."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2016 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Ted Cruz "wanted to let in more Syrian refugees and give amnesty to illegal immigrants."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2016 in a commentary published in the Austin American-Statesman:
quote_txt: "Texas has 600,000 registered voters who don’t have the kind of photo ID needed to vote."

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2016 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says Nevada state Sen. Michael Roberson "forced Common Core for Nevada schools."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2016 in in an episode of "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt":
quote_txt: "Dolphins are rapists. Look it up."

description_txt: stated on April 19, 2016 in a Medium post:
quote_txt: "In last week’s debate, Bernie questioned Hillary’s commitment to fighting climate change because a whopping 0.2 percent of the money given to our campaign has come from employees of oil and gas companies. Not even 2 percent, mind you: 0.2 percent."

description_txt: stated on April 21, 2016 in a campaign rally speech:
quote_txt: "Pennsylvania has lost 35 percent of its manufacturing jobs since 2001" and "Harrisburg has lost 40 percent of its manufacturing jobs since 2001."

description_txt: stated on April 19, 2016 in an op-ed in the Huffington Post:
quote_txt: "Studies have consistently failed to establish the existence of a link between the harshness of a country’s drug laws and its levels of drug use."

description_txt: stated on March 22, 2016 in remarks to reporters at NFL annual meeting:
quote_txt: Says it’s "absurd" to say there’s enough data to establish a link between playing football and Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy.

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2016 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Under the federal Controlled Substance Act, marijuana is listed in the same Schedule I as heroin," even though "marijuana is not a killer drug like heroin."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2016 in in interview on Meet The Press with Chuck Todd:
quote_txt: The Human Rights Campaign is "more powerful than the NRA."

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2016 in a Fox Business interview:
quote_txt: "Andrew Jackson was the last president who actually balanced the federal budget, where we had no national debt."

description_txt: stated on April 21, 2016 in a town hall on ABC's 'Good Morning America':
quote_txt: "When I withdrew in June of 2008, polls were showing that at least 40 percent of my supporters said, oh, they weren't going to support Sen. Obama."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2016 in an episode of "Redacted Tonight":
quote_txt: "In 2009 … Hillary Clinton was at the State Department working with U.S. corporations to pressure Haiti not to raise the minimum wage to 61 cents an hour from 24 cents."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2016 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: "Steve Santarsiero wrote PA’s Gun Safety Law."

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2016 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Ted Cruz is mathematically out of winning the race."

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2016 in in a speech:
quote_txt: Says professional football coach Rex Ryan "won championships in New York. The AFC, I think, twice."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2016 in an interview on ABC's 'This Week':
quote_txt: Says that in her speech to the pro-Israel group AIPAC, Hillary Clinton "had one line on the Palestinian people."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2016 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "As a U.S. senator with salary and perks, ‪#‎Bernie‬ is in the top 1 percent, but still paid only 13 percent in taxes last year."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2016 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "Washington politicians are paid over $200,000 an hour for speeches."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 20, 2016

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in an interview:
quote_txt: Wisconsin pays criminal defense lawyers who represent the indigent $40 per hour, "the lowest in the country."
